title: croissant
description: A croissant is a buttery, flaky, viennoiserie pastry of Austrian origin, named for its historical crescent shape.

title: baguette
description: A baguette is a long, thin loaf of French bread, It is distinguishable by its length and crisp crust.

title: pain de campagne
description: Pain de campagne ("country bread" in French), also called "French sourdough", is typically a large round loaf made from either natural leavening or baker's yeast.

title: pain au chocolat
description: Pain au chocolat is a type of viennoiserie sweet roll consisting of a cuboid-shaped piece of yeast-leavened laminated dough, similar in texture to a puff pastry, with one or two pieces of dark chocolate in the centre.

title: éclair
description: An éclair is an oblong pastry made with choux dough filled with a cream and topped with chocolate/coffee icing.

title: macaron
description: These have a debated origin but the earliest form of modern macaron was likely baked in France in the 1800s. French macarons are made with a mixture of almond flour and confectioners' sugar which is folded into a meringueof stiffly beaten egg whites.

title: mille-feuilles
description: The mille-feuille("thousand sheets") is traditionally made up of three layers of puff pastry, alternating with two layers of pastry cream.

title: canelé
description: A small pastry with a soft and tender custard center and a dark, thick caramelized crust.

title: kouign-amann
description: A Breton cake containing layers of butter and sugar folded in, similar in fashion to puff pastry albeit with fewer layers. The sugar caramelizes during baking.

title: sausage sandwich
description: A baguette sandwich with dry sausage and pickles

title: ham and cheese
description: A baguette sandwich with ham, cheese and veggies

title: lemon meringue pie (6 servings)
description: Lemon meringue pie is a type of baked pie, usually served for dessert, made with a crust made of shortcrust pastry, lemon custard filling and a fluffy meringue topping. Lemon meringue pie is prepared with a bottom pie crust, with the meringue directly on top of the lemon filling.

title: financier
description: A financier is a small French almond cake, flavoured with beurre noisette, baked in a small mold. Light and moist with a crisp, eggshell-like exterior. Contains egg whites, flour, and powdered sugar.
